intro: Chondrilla alba, commonly known as white cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its hairy, succulent leaves. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Chondrilla alba is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is considered a hardy, adaptable species.
